meanings.definition: To strike or hit with great force.
meanings.sent1: He porked the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The boxer porked his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The chef porked the dough to make it flat like a pancake.
meanings.sent4: The storm porked the trees, bending them to the ground.
meanings.sent5: She porked the door shut with all her might.

meanings.definition: To have sexual intercourse with someone.
meanings.sent1: They porked in the bedroom last night.
meanings.sent2: The movie characters decided to pork after their date.
meanings.sent3: The pigs in the farm were caught porking by the farmer.
meanings.sent4: The lovebirds porked under the starry sky.
meanings.sent5: The couple porked passionately in the moonlight.

meanings.sent1: He porked his friend by taking his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The scammer porked innocent people out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox porked the rabbit by pretending to be its friend.
meanings.sent4: The con artist porked the old lady with a fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent5: She porked her way to the top by lying about her qualifications.
